# Make it Legible

## To Do
Increase all text size at once using the `base_size` argument

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
penguins <- read.csv("https://www.ggplot2-uncharted.com/data/palmerpenguins.csv")


ggplot(penguins) +
  aes(x = bill_length_mm,
      y = bill_depth_mm,
      color = species) +
  geom_point() +
  theme_gray(
    base_size = 18
  ) + 
  ggtitle("Bill ratios of Pygoscelis penguins")
```

# The `ipsum` Theme

**Apply `theme_ipsum()` from the hrbrthemes package** instead to replace the default grey look with a lighter, cleaner theme.

This doesn't only look more pleasing but also improves readability â€” the colored points stand out more clearly against the white background.

```{r}
library(readr)
library(hrbrthemes)

simpsons <- read_csv("https://www.ggplot2-uncharted.com/data/simpsons_episodes.csv")

ggplot(simpsons) +
  aes(x = original_air_date, y = imdb_rating, 
      color = us_viewers_in_millions) +
  geom_point(size = 2) +
  stat_smooth(se = FALSE, color = "black") +
  scale_color_viridis_c(direction = -1) +
  theme_ipsum()
```
